GSD.description: PHP 7.3 through 8.1 have a bug in the disable_functions() which handles string concatenation. Certain strings can trigger a memory corruption in specific conditions resulting in code execution. It should be noted that an additional bug occurs in PHP before 7.3 which appears to prevent exploitation of this issue.
